channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI reorganizes research team behind ChatGPT’s personality
item.description: OpenAI is shuffling the team that shapes its AI models' behavior, and its leader is moving on to another project within the company.

item.title: The Top New Gadgets We Saw at IFA Berlin 2025
item.description: A tennis-playing robot, a projector in a party speaker, and a whole bunch of new AI-powered wearables. Here are some of the best gadgets we saw at IFA...

item.title: Anthropic Agrees to Pay Authors at Least $1.5 Billion in AI Copyright Settlement
item.description: Anthropic will pay at least $3,000 for each copyrighted work that it pirated. The company downloaded unauthorized copies of books in early efforts to ...

item.title: Defense Department Scrambles to Pretend It’s Called the War Department
item.description: President Donald Trump said the so-called Department of War branding is to counter the “woke” Department of Defense name.

item.title: Personalized AI companion app Dot is shutting down
item.description: Dot, a personalized AI companion, is shutting down.

item.title: Top Spec Razer Blade Laptops Are Average 14 Percent Off Right Now
item.description: This slim gaming laptop is one of our favorites, with an impressive design and the power to match.

item.title: Tesla Proposes a Trillion-Dollar Bet That It's More Than Just Cars
item.description: Tesla’s board wants to give Elon Musk an unprecedented $1 trillion pay package. To get all the money, he has to make robots and robotaxis work.

item.title: Attorneys general warn OpenAI ‘harm to children will not be tolerated’
item.description: California Attorney General Rob Bonta and Delaware Attorney General Kathy Jennings met with and sent an open letter to OpenAI to express their concern...

item.title: Google Gemini dubbed ‘high risk’ for kids and teens in new safety assessment
item.description: Google's Gemini comes up short on kids' safety, says Common Sense Media.

item.title: Screw the money — Anthropic’s $1.5B copyright settlement sucks for writers
item.description: Writers aren't getting this settlement because their work was fed to an AI -- this is just a costly slap on the wrist for Anthropic because it illegal...
